diagnosis.final_diagnosis: acute perforated cholecystitis s/p open cholecystectomy
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The diagnosis of acute perforated cholecystitis was supported by imaging findings of a distended gallbladder, gallbladder wall thickening, pericholecystic fat stranding, and discontinuity of the gallbladder wall indicating perforation, along with clinical presentation of abdominal pain.
